fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27362].
  {panel}

# _Administration >> Issues >> Issues Attributes >> Priorities >> Add 'New Priority' >> Add_
# _Create Issue >> Set Issue Priority >> 'New Priority' >> Create_
# _Administration >> Issues >> Priorities >> Delete 'New Priority' >> Set New Priority for Matching Issues >> Delete >> *System Error*_

{noformat}
com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: Failed to remove priority '6'
	at com.atlassian.jira.config.DefaultPriorityManager.removePriority(DefaultPriorityManager.java:134)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.priorities.DeletePriority.doExecute(DeletePriority.java:69)
	at webwork.action.ActionSupport.execute(ActionSupport.java:165)
	at com.atlassian.jira.action.JiraActionSupport.execute(JiraActionSupport.java:82)
	at webwork.interceptor.DefaultInterceptorChain.proceed(DefaultInterceptorChain.java:39)
	at webwork.interceptor.NestedInterceptorChain.proceed(NestedInterceptorChain.java:31)
	at webwork.interceptor.ChainedInterceptor.intercept(ChainedInterceptor.java:16)
	at webwork.interceptor.DefaultInterceptorChain.proceed(DefaultInterceptorChain.java:35)
	at webwork.dispatcher.GenericDispatcher.executeAction(GenericDispatcher.java:205)
	at webwork.dispatcher.GenericDispatcher.executeAction(GenericDispatcher.java:143)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.dispatcher.JiraWebworkActionDispatcher.service(JiraWebworkActionDispatcher.java:152)
	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:717)
{noformat}

All issues which have priority going to be deleted should be moved to the intended priority but it is not working.

h4. Workaround: 
Do bulk edit to all the issues with the priority level that need to be deleted. Change all of them to another priority level, and then delete the intended priority level.
fields.summary: System Error Occurs when User Try to Delete Active Issue Priority

fields.description:
jira-user:
 Logged in as Forrest (with permissions on projects Foo and Bar).
 Created or edited an issue.
 Became user Jenny (with permissions on Bar only).

jira-system-administrator not in Admin mode:
 Logged in as Bubba (with permissions on projects Foo and Bar).
 Created an issue in Foo.
 Edited that issue to set a FixVersion.
 Also became user Jenny (with permissions on Bar only).

The JIRA log and Tomcat log show nothing obviously causative.

By "became user X", I mean that the affected person is suddenly logged in as user X, with the full capabilities and limitations of user X, rather than as self.

v5.0#713-sha1:aec58e2

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27288].
  {panel}

A support issue was caused by a misconfiguration of JIRA that caused different values shown between:
- "Number of resolved issues" shown on the Roadmap view (/browse/GX#selectedTab=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.project%3Aroadmap-panel) , eg "2 of 24 issues have been resolved"
- The actual number of issues shown when a user clicks on the link for the number of resolved issues.

Essentially the cause was that the admin had created an "Unresolved" issue resolution.

JIRA interprets resolution=null as "Unresolved" when displaying an issue and in JQL. Creating a resolution whose name is "Unresolved" causes JQL to produce incorrect results, so we should not allow it.
fields.summary: A custom resolution of "Unresolved" should not be allowed
REST API Feedback after ShipIt 19
RMA Request
test

fields.description:
Recently upgraded from 4.4 to 5.0.

The default system dashboard's config was never touched, nor was the activity stream plugin.

After upgrading to 5.0, the Activity Stream plugin began displaying the following error: "An error occurred while trying to retrieve recent activity."

When editing the Actility Stream plugin while the error is showing, I see:

Available Streams
Each stream can be toggled and customised individually.
JIRA(add filter)
Bamboo(add filter)

Both JIRA and Bamboo are checked.

I do not have any filters setup for either of these.

If I uncheck one of the two leaving only a single stream in place, the plugin populates with the stream in question.

It will not work with both enabled.

RSS URL when both are enabled and error is happening:
https://jira.mona4.com/plugins/servlet/gadgets/ifr?container=atlassian&mid=10100&country=US&lang=en&view=default&view-params=%7B%22writable%22%3A%22true%22%7D&st=atlassian%3AXCe%2BWqsyu5apOwyMbcc3j2wr%2BDzjvwxJRH05uAaIxFFylQQ56rd2yBWb%2F96DL3%2FSIyIHNXNrAD5GNBwFEwXo2Jh7nPOO7f21sV6%2FvweEgv7NPYZF20EC7QzX7c80DgjQAZNVGG5nlEpusIUK9wF0d3A10p98aCImZ6SF5kz0x%2BVMrP7RpQBwAp2%2BmOi%2Byl61Bx1AyzuJAJL%2FOvLYyKBHiGlA2GEW3eSVzRBBM3oByBsNCqYGRqAMoD52b4ZrI3p0E6ZkOBTMiFpVRkZeECJwwfVTyL0j1qNo%2BgUBrnqJ0ngyUKo%2FMEQNVcVDpat6prvKMB3690iLKwUzUOVi4279TEWzsp4%3D&up_isConfigured=true&up_isReallyConfigured=true&up_title=Activity%2520Stream&up_titleRequired=true&up_numofentries=10&up_refresh=15&up_maxProviderLabelCharacters=50&up_rules=%257B%2522providers%2522%253A%255B%257B%2522provider%2522%253A%2522streams%2522%252C%2522rules%2522%253A%255B%255D%252C%2522disabled%2522%253Atrue%257D%252C%257B%2522provider%2522%253A%2522issues%2522%252C%2522rules%2522%253A%255B%255D%257D%252C%257B%2522provider%2522%253A%2522builds%2540ae8f8ad1-3dd2-3629-9b6e-34c13ee8ffae%2522%252C%2522rules%2522%253A%255B%255D%257D%255D%257D&up_renderingContext=&up_keys=&up_itemKeys=&up_username=&url=https%3A%2F%2Fjira.mona4.com%2Frest%2Fgadgets%2F1.0%2Fg%2Fcom.atlassian.streams.streams-jira-plugin%3Aactivitystream-gadget%2Fgadgets%2Factivitystream-gadget.xml&libs=auth-refresh#

RSS URL with only JIRA enabled and plugin working:
https://jira.mona4.com/activity?maxResults=10&providers=issues&os_authType=basic&title=Activity%20Stream

RSS URL with only Bamboo enabled and plugin working:
https://jira.mona4.com/activity?maxResults=5&providers=builds%40ae8f8ad1-3dd2-3629-9b6e-34c13ee8ffae&os_authType=basic&title=Bentley%20Global%20Arts

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27278].
  {panel}

Hi,

As per our documentation, the operator {{Changed}} is not compatible with  {{MembersOf}} operator. But there is no error shown up on the Issue navigator when using these in a JQL.

For example: {noformat}resolution changed by membersOf("ruchi (test)"){noformat}

Steps to reproduce:
# create a group with brackets in the name
# create a filter where this group is reporter
# use this filter for a time since chart
# click on one of the bars
# error appears.

So there is something wrong with the Time Since Chart. Either we need to update our documentation or we need to show a relevant error message to the user when using Time Since Chart with an invalid query.

Regards,
Ruchi
fields.summary: Time Since chart resulting in invalid query whenever the operators 'changed' is used with 'membersOf'
Bulk update role memberships in projects

fields.description:
I'm trying to create a custom workflow from the default Jira workflow. When creating new transition i choose to clone an existing one e.g. "Start Progress". I create a new transition called "Start Test". The problem is that the name is not updated in the transition button on the view issue screen. I changed the name manually from the xml file and then i import the workflow in my Jira Instance. i'm giving a detail of the xml file below. The problem is caused because the meta name remains the same.

{code:xml} 
<action id="721" name="Start Test">
      <meta name="opsbar-sequence">20</meta>
      <meta name="jira.description">This transition is executed when the necessary info has been gathered and tests can start.</meta>
      <meta name="jira.i18n.title">startprogress.title</meta>
....
....
{code}
fields.summary: When cloning a transition doesn't update the title that appears in transition button

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27272].
  {panel}

Hi,

as described on [Logging Work on an Issue|http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/RQISCw] you are able to set up the "copy comment to worklog description".

This is quite good for all use cases, where users enters time within my workflow transition screens. For all users logging time AFTER transition (or just using the menu > log work action) are able to enter a "work log description" instead of an comment.
i.e. that all "comments" witihin direct work logs are "lost" and not visible in the comment stream.

It's NOT a workaround using the "all" tab while there are MAANY informations which are not relevant for the discussion stream.

so can you please
* add a "copy worklog description to comment" too
OR
* just enable it with the existing option, because it would solve it vor 99,9% of users I expect
OR
* give an option to disable the manual "log work" in the menu"
OR
* give a combined "comment and worklog" view to the users interface

Thank you
~Marcel
fields.summary: Log work comments and log work descriptions not consistent

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27254].
  {panel}

As a user, I want to search for issues that were in progress on the last working day, to provide context for my team's daily stand-up meeting.

Currently the best I can do with JQL is "status WAS IN ("In Progress") AFTER startOfDay(-1)", which does not work on a Monday because the last working day was 3 days ago.

I therefore want a "startOfLastWorkingDay()" function to return the start of the last working day.  When called on a Monday, it would return the start of the preceding Friday.  It should also skip over registered non-working holidays.

Alternatively, I want a "-1wd" syntax to subtract working days from the date, such that startOfDay("-1wd") executed on a Monday returns the start of the previous Friday.
fields.summary: JQL function to return start of last working day

Basically, a function similar to "linkedAllIssues" provided by JQL Tricks Plugin where a search like this can be performed:

I have one issue "ABC-1" which is linked to from "ABC-2"

"XYZ-2" is linked to from "MNO-4"

Thank you.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27232].
  {panel}

1. As sysadmin, go to Administration -> Logging & Profiling
2. Enable Profiling

Receive error:

{code}

java.lang.IllegalStateException: We really expect the implementation of OpTimerFactory to in fact be a ThreadLocalOpTimerFactory
	at com.atlassian.jira.instrumentation.Instrumentation.snapshotThreadLocalOperationsAndClear(Instrumentation.java:134)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.filters.steps.instrumentation.InstrumentationStep.finallyAfterDoFilter(InstrumentationStep.java:46)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.filters.steps.ChainedFilterStepRunner.doFilter(ChainedFilterStepRunner.java:85)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:235)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.doFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:206)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardWrapperValve.invoke(StandardWrapperValve.java:233)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContextValve.invoke(StandardContextValve.java:191)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardHostValve.invoke(StandardHostValve.java:127)
	at org.apache.catalina.valves.ErrorReportValve.invoke(ErrorReportValve.java:102)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardEngineValve.invoke(StandardEngineValve.java:109)
	at org.apache.catalina.valves.AccessLogValve.invoke(AccessLogValve.java:554)
	at org.apache.catalina.connector.CoyoteAdapter.service(CoyoteAdapter.java:298)
	at org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Processor.process(Http11Processor.java:859)
	at org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Protocol$Http11ConnectionHandler.process(Http11Protocol.java:588)
	at org.apache.tomcat.util.net.JIoEndpoint$Worker.run(JIoEndpoint.java:489)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:662)
{code}

after this, the same error is seen when accessing the JIRA home page (dashboard).

To bring the instance back to a workable state, hit

{code}
/secure/admin/ViewLogging!disableProfiling.jspa
{code}
fields.summary: Turning on logging & profiling causes a server error, causing further errors in the entire instance
Upgrade JIRA integration plugin for Team Calendars to 1.0.4

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27223].
  {panel}

When creating a "Internal with LDAP authentication" directory in JIRA, we have the message:

{quote}
Configure Internal with LDAP Authentication User Directory

JIRA can use LDAP for user authentication only. To be able to log in to JIRA with this configuration, users must either be created first in JIRA, or the option 'Copy User on First Login' can be checked to automatically add them to JIRA's internal directory. Copied users can subsequently be modified in Confluence, but modifications will not be reflected on the LDAP server.

Groups and memberships from the LDAP server will not be used. However, users from LDAP can be added to groups maintained in JIRA's internal directory.
{quote}

Let's say the user's info is the following:
* uid=testuser
* mail=testuser@ldapemail.com

If we try to change an attribute for one of the users in this delegated directory, for example, the email address (changing from *testuser@ldapemail.com* to *testuser@jiraemail.com*), next time the users logs in JIRA, the email address is set to the *testuser@ldapemail.com*. 

This behaviour also can be observed by editing the user's Full Name.
fields.summary: LDAP users from delegated directory cannot change their information though JIRA UI

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27222].
  {panel}

For adding things, I think the new pop-up add panel is great.

However, when I am on the page showing the entire issue, and I click Edit, I'm really surprised to be constrained just to the add sheet. Part of the benefit of the small panel is that it doesn't completely block what's going on. However, in the case of editing the issue that you're currently looking at, it is not only odd, but frustrating.

In particular, I lose a ton of screen real-estate showing "through" the old information which I'm currently editing, and it constrains my ability to both view and edit the information for that ticket.

As I indicated, for adding, it's great, but then I would expect that if the "smaller form" of the page weren't sufficient, I could just click on the issue and I'd be able to edit in my full window, which isn't the case.
fields.summary: 5.0 quick create quick edit is great for adding, bad for editing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27219].
  {panel}

I want to change the color of the header bar so I go to Administration, Look and Feel (http://localhost:8081/secure/admin/EditLookAndFeel!default.jspa)
and then click Update to change the values. I scroll down and click on Edit Configuration button. I expected to be given editable fields for the colors and a color picker as in previous releases. Instead I was taken back to the previous page.

My mistake was that I should I have expanded the Customize Colors and Dates section, edited the values there and then clicked Update. 

This user error could be reduced if a line of text were added under "Customize Colours And Dates" saying something like "Expand to set the values for the colours and dates."
fields.summary: Look and Feel edit UI not obvious

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27215].
  {panel}

Improve the documentation [Connecting to an Internal Directory with LDAP Authentication|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA044/Connecting+to+an+Internal+Directory+with+LDAP+Authentication].

Our doc current says: "On LDAP, all that the application does is to check the password."

But if we use the option "Copy Users in the first login", information like email address, first name, last name is retrieved. 

After the users is copied, if we edit its email for example, to an email address that doesn't match the one in LDAP, next time the users logs in JIRA, the username is changed back to the one in LDAP.

Our documentation needs to reflect this behavior.

Thanks!

Clarissa.
fields.summary: Improve the documentation Connecting to an Internal Directory with LDAP Authentication

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

I have java error message: java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused
Maybe it is the reason why i cannot proceed with instalation.
Could You help me to resolve this problem.

Refards
Jacek Sysiak

2. Assign this workflow to an appropriate workflow scheme & project

Receive the error:

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27202].
  {panel}

Hi,

When you release in Rapid Board (kanban mode) and several Rapid Boards are using more or less the same projects, you easily run inte name space problems. A better approach would be to use separate "Global Fix Version" attribute(s) but such version attributs would be a conceptual new thing in JIRA. 

These things influence the way we should map JIRA projects over sections of our product structure so it is really important.

Regards,
Ruchi
fields.summary: Global Fix Version field would be nice to have
Filter activity stream on the issue page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27200].
  {panel}

Applinks Issue:  https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/APL-1006

*Steps to reproduce*
# Create a user 'admin' with the group 'jira-administrators' only
# Create 'confluence-administrators' and 'confluence-users' group in JIRA
# Set Confluence to use JIRA as 'Remote JIRA directory' and use it as the primary directory
# Set the user 'admin' in Confluence so that it have all the administrative permission (Confluence Administrator, System Administrator and Space Admin) with the group 'jira-administrator' only (The other default administrative permission for Confluence groups are not removed)
# Setup the Application Links between JIRA and Confluence with Trusted Applications for both Incoming and Outgoing Authentications
# Try to set the Project Application Links at {{JIRA Administration >> Project >> <Project_name> >> Settings >> Configure Application Links}} to Confluence Space (No permission error):"Sorry, there are no links for this user available, check your permission configuration of the remote application."
!project_app_links.png!
# Trying to set the Space Application Link from Confluence at {{Confluence Space Admin >> Application Links}} to JIRA is working
# Give the default administrative group 'confluence-administrators' to the user 'admin' in Confluence
# Try to set Project Application Links from JIRA server again works

Why would it still need the Confluence group to administrate Confluence even though Confluence already give the permission to JIRA groups?
fields.summary: Project Application Links permission error

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27198].
  {panel}

By default, when a user is moving an issue to another project, the reporter of the issue must have a create issue permission

There are times when an issue is needed to be moved to another project, but the reporter should not have the create issue permission for that particular project.  Therefore, I believe there should be a configuration whereby an issue can be moved regardless of the reporter's create issue permission.  The move procedures can only be done by a JIRA administration.

As a scenario:
"I guess I think of it like this: Imagine if you guys created a project for "Issues raised by important customers" - and defined the permissions so that people like me couldn't create issues directly in this project, but a responsible atlassian administrator could move an issue that I raised into this project if I was discovered to be an important customer. Mr Atlassian Admin is carrying out his weekly review and moves 60 issues into this new project - and JIRA requests that he choose a new reporter for all 60 issues. Now you don't know who raised them!"
fields.summary: Move Issue Configuration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27195].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:
* Add a new workflow
* Add a step to that workflow (so you now have create, open and a 3rd step)
* Create a transition from that new step to Open (note the order)
* Choose 'Use common transition' when creating the transition
* Choose 'Create (1)' in the dropdown
* Click create
* Exception is hit

The new transition is rendered useless and no actions can be performed on it. If you exit the designer and reopen it, the new transition has disappeared and all functionality is back to normal.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27166].
  {panel}

You can refer to this ticket: JSP-115535

This would be great to let us select which group of permissions users may have access to.

For example, we have subversion and FishEye plugin in Jira. Currently they are linked to "View Version Control" permission so we could not give specific permission for each plugins.

Our request feature would be to let create group permission for plugins.

Please don't hesitate to contact me if I'm unclear or want more details.

Best regards,
fields.summary: Plugin permissions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27164].
  {panel}

Hi all,

It would be nice to see in the workflow (available if you click the "View workflow" link) :
* for the old status of the current issue, the date and the assignee.
* the current status
* the available transitions for me
without consulting all, history or activity stream.

This could give us the overview.
fields.summary: View Workflow improvements

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27163].
  {panel}

I have spoken to Sergey Markovich from Plugenta Labs about getting SuggestiMate included as plugin for Jira OnDemand.

They said they are trying to figure out the way for our plugin to be approved for JIRA On Demand and that you guys at Atlassian definitely make important efforts to simplify the process but there are some pretty reasonable considerations on your part regarding running 3rd party plugins in your hosted environment.

I really hope I cna encourage you to sustain your efforts so that eventually SuggestiMate will be available for all JIRA On Demand users, it is an amazing time and sanity saver.

Cheers Nick

Best regards,
Sergey Markovich
Plugenta Labs
http://www.plugenta.com
fields.summary: SuggestiMate plugin request
While I'm editing the Description field, a large swathe of the text...
URL Encoding for excel filename headers uses + for spaces and this is not interpreted correctly by all browsers
JQL for Unassigned Issues Makes No Sense
double-question marks ?? in JQuery-posted AJAX causes errors
CROWD: Troubleshooting LDAP User Management
JIRA allows inserting invalid characters in text fields
Update attachment without changing url
Add parent option when moving task between projects
Move sub tasks within project - update bulk edit/move to allow moving sub tasks between task and story within same project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27148].
  {panel}

Currently a user needs to be in the Jira-administrators group to edit the workflow of a project

Once a user is an administrator of a project (such as Project Manager) we would like them to be able to make changes within that project without limitation - so they can edit their own workflows while not affecting others

Current usage means that either support staff that may not have the time or knowledge to update the workflow for an individual project as often as required or we need to add the project manager into jira-administrators, which gives them control over the entire environment - which is not ideal

We would like to be able to define permissions for all elements of projects using permission schemes and users/groups
fields.summary: Add property to allow users not in jira-administrators to edit project workflows
Workflow designer should allow users to change the line type even if the workflow is active

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27145].
  {panel}

Background. Someone modified server.xml(/app/tomcat/conf/server.xml) and ours App's(mentioned above) were unable to start.

I was unable to intepret this information neither form atlassian*.log or catalina.out.

Is it possible to have a different levels of loggings configs for app's so in instance like yesterday we can trace the issue.

Example:
Connection to port 8081 refused please check your server.xml? something like that?

Please let me know if you need any further information.
fields.summary: JIRA/Confluence/Fisheye/Crowd to have various levels of logging for Start-up and Shutdown.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27143].
  {panel}

Hi,

The membersOf() operatorin JQL does not support a lot of operators like : 
{noformat}=

!=

~

!~

>

>=

<

<=

IS

IS NOT

WAS

WAS IN

WAS NOT

WAS NOT IN

CHANGED{noformat}
It would be nice if these operators can be used with membersOf().
fields.summary: JQL membersOf() does not support a lot of operators

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27140].
  {panel}

1. Launch the KeyBoard Short cuts dialog using 'Shift' + '?'
2. Observe that TEmpo and GreenHopper use the same Global Shortcut

'g' and 't'.

!tempo_gh.png!

When both GreenHopper and Tempo are enabled on an instance, this shortcut does nothing.

Disabling one of them, works for another. E.g. If GH is disabled then 'g' and 't' shows the Tempo screen and vice - versa.
fields.summary: Tempo and GH use same Global Shortcut and the shortcut does not work in OnDemand
Re-resolve plugin dependencies when another plugin is installed/upgraded

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27138].
  {panel}

Hi Giles

As discussed previously, please update the following pages to include step-by-step instructions, for completing a task such as managing project permissions, first (i.e. at the top) for the following pages:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Managing+Global+Permissions

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Defining+a+Screen#DefiningaScreen-fieldtabs (for creating a tab) (/)
* I've decided to leave this one 'as is' since the screenshots (above the step-by-step instructions) demonstrate the purpose behind configuring these field tabs. Since the screenshots also illustrate the example description (which is part of the introductory blurb about configuring field tabs), I thought it best to leave them where they were. I agree though (i.e. in reference to the other doc pages in this issue) that it's better to move tables of reference information below their step-by-step instructions, as their content is too specific and do not form part of the introductory material.

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Managing+Project+Permissions

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Labelling+an+Issue

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Logging+Work+on+an+Issue

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Modifying+Multiple+%28%27Bulk%27%29+Issues
* Update outdated screenshots on this page too.

Cheers

Geoff
fields.summary: Update JIRA documentation pages to have step-by-step instructions first
Outdated time zones in JIRA
Automatically reject all sub-tasks if parent task is rejected
Frother control in group picker fields do not decrement matching fields as they are selected, this means lower fields cannot be selected
Change Assignee while resolve issue on trunk or branch
Provide OnDemand Look & Feel to Integrated Standalone Applications

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27122].
  {panel}

It seems there are two options for when JIRA gets an email at a monitored mailbox from an unrecognized address: create a new user, or report through a default issue creator user.

We were hoping to to use JIRA for external support as well as internal bug tracking, but we now see it's not really possible.

With the first option, lots and lots of users get created. Our 5-person company has hundreds of customers. We simply cannot justify an $8000, unlimited license when in reality, only 5 people will be using JIRA on a regular basis, and the rest of the external customers will probably only once use it or twice when they have issues with our software.

We had some hope that, when we exceed our license limit, the users are still created, but without 'jira-users' and can't login or get notifications unless the entire project is public with browser permission, etc. This is also unacceptable, since a user could view another user's support request simply by playing with the issue number!

With the second option, it's impossible to correspond with the reporting users through JIRA. (We see that JIRA5rc3 now adds a line indicating the address the issue was recved from even if it was created by anonymous). This is useful info. But it's impossible to communicate with them over JIRA and have a record of the support ticket in this case because the notifications only go to the default issue creator, not the reporter.

If you are going to advertise the dual use of JIRA, you should have a permissions scheme that reflects this so that my 5-person company doesn't need to buy an unlimited license to use it as support. (There are MUCH CHEAPER support tools out there, but we were attracted by the concept of using a single product for both support and bug tracking).

How about splitting it up so that you have a jira-staff permission, and a jira-customer permission? With a n-person license, you can have up to n jira-staff (who can log in, send and recv notifications, create and update any issue, etc), and unlimited jira-customers (who can log in, but only view and comment on issues they have created, etc).

This would make JIRA so much better, would make your marketing less misleading, and make the licensing model better match this use case.
fields.summary: Another privilege level for email- or externally-created issues, for support purposes
